themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The inscription follows the standard formula for a public decree issued by the city of Viannos and its magistrates (kosmoi).
themes.quote: ἔδοξεν Βιαννίων τοῖς κόσμοις καὶ τᾶι πόλει

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The text explicitly praises the ambassadors from Teos for their zeal and conduct on behalf of their homeland.
themes.quote: ἐπαινοῦμεν δὲ καὶ τοὺς πρεσβευτὰς Ἡρόδοτον καὶ Μενεκλῆν

themes.label: Treaties and Agreements
themes.rationale: The decree reaffirms and renews the pre-existing diplomatic ties of kinship and friendship between the cities of Viannos and Teos.
themes.quote: διὰ τε τὴν συγγένειαν καὶ τὴν φιλίαν τὴν προϋπάρχουσαν

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The decree recognizes the religious status of Teos as a city consecrated to Dionysus and possessing the right of asylia (inviolability).
themes.quote: τὰν πόλιν ἐκ τῶν προγόνων ἡμῶν καθιερωμέναν τῶι Διονύσωι καὶ ἄσυλον γεγενημέναν

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The inscription names the presiding magistrate (kosmos) Dexios and his father Glaukos, serving as a dating formula.
themes.ambiguity_note: Used here as a dating formula rather than a standalone list.

themes.label: Calendars and Timetables
themes.rationale: The text specifies the month in which the decree was enacted, providing a chronological reference.

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The decree orders that the text be inscribed on stone steles for public display.
themes.quote: ἀναγράψομεν δὲ τὸ τε πρότερον δόγμα στήλαι λιθίναι

themes.label: Other Stone
themes.rationale: The inscription is carved on stone, specifically identified as 'lithos' in the text.

themes.label: Fragmentary
themes.rationale: The text contains several lacunae and missing letters that require epigraphic reconstruction.

themes.label: Damaged but Legible
themes.rationale: Despite the missing fragments, the majority of the decree's content and the names of the individuals involved are legible.
themes.quote: δοξεν βιαννίων τοῖς κόσμοις καὶ τᾶι πόλει

rationale: This inscription is a diplomatic decree from the Cretan city of Viannos responding to an embassy from Teos. It reaffirms the ancestral kinship (syngeneia) and friendship (philia) between the two states. Crucially, it recognizes the status of Teos as a sacred and inviolable city (asylia) dedicated to Dionysus. The decree honors the ambassadors Herodotus and Menecles for their service and provides for the publication of the text on stone steles, dated by the kosmos Dexios in the month of Eleusinios.
